transcript.title: NEW ZEALAND’S PRIME MINISTER TO VISIT AUSTRALIA
transcript.content:
I am happy to announce that New Zealand's Prime Minister, Mrs

Jenny Shipley, has accepted my invitation to visit Australia. Mrs

Shipley will visit Sydney on 19-20 February.

New Zealand is one of Australia's closest and most important

partners. I am confident this visit - Mrs Shipley's first since

she became Prime Minister - will build on the strong relationship

between our two countries.

Mrs Shipley will come to Kirribilli House on 19 February for dinner.

We will continue our discussions at a meeting the next day.

I look forward to discussing with Mrs Shipley the many issues in which

we have shared interests, both trans-Tasman and in our region, including

our mutual commitment to assisting the peace process on Bougainville

and the impact of the economic crisis in Asia.
